content: Have you tried using the export in the address book user interface? I think you should. Right click the address book name in the list. (excluding the all address books virtual book.)
creator: MattAuSupport

content:
Is it possible to block certain email address ...

The attempt to fight spam with static filters is futile. Use the built-in Junk Mail Controls instead. https://support.mozilla.org/kb/thunderbird-and-junk-spam-messages
creator: christ1

content: try this: highlight the global inbox (the thunderbird term is 'unified inbox') - rightclick and select properties and then click 'choose' - locate the new account and tick it - do this for input, sent, trash, etc. in each unified folder
creator: davidsk

content: Oh you are a genius. :) Thank you so much David, I really appreciate your help. So simple yet ...

content: Settings are being saved on the fly. There is no way or button to explicitly save settings. So settings you changed will automatically be applied the next time you start Thunderbird.
creator: christ1

content: Thunderbird retains the last password you gave it at settings>privacy&security. If your password no longer works, you need to contact your email provider.
creator: davidsk

content: I am unclear on what you are describing. Are you saying that when you rightclick an email address in your FROM list the drop-down menu offers the option to 'add to address book' when it's already there? Please clarify. thank you.
creator: davidsk

content: Thunderbird evaluates each incoming message, so marking it as junk does not guarantee it remains junk. If there is a specific sender causing this, I suggest creating a filter. You might also check your online account, as that may offer a spam filter to set it once.
creator: davidsk

content: That would be an OS issue. Try this link: https://www.howtogeek.com/208224/how-to-add-a-program-to-startup-in-windows/
